title: Welcome
text:
Welcome to My Portfolio


Hello, I’m Justin Tan - Applied Computing Student at SIT



About Me


Hello, my name is Justin Tan.
I am currently a student at Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT), studying Applied Computing.
This website showcases some of my school work, data visualization examples, and reflections on using AI tools for learning.


About this site




School Projects


Explore my work projects and see how I’ve applied what I’ve learned in real situations.




Data Visualization Work


Check out examples of how I turn numbers and data into charts and visuals that are easy to understand.




Personal Reflection on AI Usage


Read my thoughts on using AI tools to help with learning and personal growth.

title: Data Visualization
text:
This page presents a simple data visualization created to demonstrate how numerical data can be represented visually to support understanding and analysis.


The dataset used in this visualization represents a set of student test scores across five assessments. The values are numerical and allow for direct comparison between different tests.

title: Data Visualization
text: scores <- c(65, 70, 78, 85, 90) barplot(scores, main = “Student Test Scores”, xlab = “Test Number”, ylab = “Score”)

title: Data Visualization
text: The dataset used in this visualization represents a set of student test scores across five assessments. The values are numerical and allow for direct comparison between different tests.

title: Data Visualization
text:
scores <- c(65, 70, 78, 85, 90)
barplot( scores, main = “Student Test Scores Across Assessments”, xlab = “Assessment Number”, ylab = “Score”, col = “steelblue” )

title: Final Year Project
section: Reflection on the Use of Generative AI
text:
Reflection on the Use of Generative AI
Generative AI was used in this project to support my learning rather than replace my own work. It helped me understand Quarto syntax, page structure, and media embedding, which allowed me to resolve issues independently.
AI also guided my understanding of basic data visualization, particularly how to present numerical data clearly. However, decisions about content, layout, and interpretation were made by me.
There were limitations, as some AI suggestions were generic and required critical review to ensure they met assessment requirements. This highlighted the importance of human judgement.
Overall, the project taught me how to use Generative AI responsibly as a learning aid to improve understanding and problem solving.
